School was like any other day there. Very few students due to there being so few of us humans left. We each had a tutor at our side, walking us through our classes but there was little interaction permitted. In fact, each teacher wore a medical mask and gloves to prevent the spreading of germs. All precautions including social distancing was ordered to keep the next generation safe from illness. We were all told that we were humanity's hope to carry on. No pressure there, right...

"You are excel in all subjects, Olivia." Smiling, my teacher, Mrs. Jones said. "You have finished today's lessons early so you are dismissed."

I smiled at that and gladly left my desk, thoroughly washing my hands before leaving the small school building. As I walked to the trans pick up to return to the transport station in the Central Hub, I noticed two blurry men watching me from a distance. They were both Maltorian and not a friendly looking pair. I picked up the pace, hoping the human only trans would be there when I arrived. It did not help my nerves to know that they had started to follow me. "What did I do to get their interest?" Worried, I thought. "I'm just going home."

I moved even faster and arrived at the trans pick up just as it had arrived. i almost literally jumped on and showed the driver my DNA ID, proving I was true blood human. The driver nodded and motioned me to take a seat. I did so and looked out the window to the frowning faces of the two Maltorian men. One took up a small radio device as the trans moved away from the school. "Those blasted Maltorian security goons seem to be everywhere these days." Grumbling, the driver said. "Any idea why they were interested in you, lass?"

I shook my head. "Not a clue." Honestly, I replied.

"Keep your senses sharp, lass." Frowning, the driver said. "There is too few of us to have your youngins disappear."

I nodded then turned to the window at the passing scenery. There was not much to see as we were in a colony on the moon but it was something to look at. Just as boredom was about to set in, a second trans going the other way stopped as mine did only a few feet away. I looked over and nearly screamed. Staring right back at me, in complete disbelief was a little girl who looked exactly like me!

For a moment, we just stared at each other as if looking at a reflection until the two trans continued on their way...
113.title: After School

1131.content:
Upon arriving at the Hub, I found mommy waiting for me. She was smiling until she saw the tears in my eyes as I ran right for her. "Olivia... what's wrong?" Concerned, she demanded. "You're shaking like a leaf!"

"Mommy... mirror people are real!" Crying, I wailed. "I saw another who looks just like me, I mean just like me!"

Mommy sighed then gave me a patient smile. "I think you have been pushing yourself too hard trying to be the best at all things." Loud enough to be heard by others, she said. "You are ahead in your studies so I see no harm in starting your weekend a day early."

She placed her hand onto my forehead and her expression turned to great concern. "Honey, you are burning up... do you feel faint?"

"I'm scared, mommy..." Sobbing, I said. "I know what I saw was real."

Mommy knotted her jaws, as she did when she had made up her mind in something. "I'm taking you to the hospital wing straight away." Firmly, she said. "You are ill."

I tried to protest but once mommy made up her mind, nothing could change it, not even dad. She took me back to the Central Hub and pulled me onto the trans. "Hospital wing." Firmly, she barked. "My daughter is very ill with fever."

The driver nodded and pressed a button near the driving console. a glass section of the bus marked Quarantine opened. Mom pulled me into the section and sat down with me before the door was sealed. We remained in that sealed glass section until we reached the hospital wing. As the tans moved along, i was in for another shock. I saw a another girl who looked a lot like mommy only she was a little younger than me!

"Maybe I am sick..." Gulping, I thought.
1131.title: I tell mom what I saw.

choices: I wake up in a strange place.
11312.content:
As we were moving along the tram to the hospital wing, Mommy seemed to be becoming more and more worried. "Mommy, what's wrong...?" Softly, I asked.

"This is not the route to the hospital." Worried, mommy replied. "We're being taken to the quarantine sector."

"The what...?" Startled, I asked.

Mommy sighed. "It is where they take the very sick." Patiently, she explained.

Shortly after, the trans stopped and two women in hazard environment suits hurried on and opened the quarantine section. "Please, Mrs Sheppard..." Calmly, the first woman said. "Your safety and the safety of your daughter is very important to us."

"What's going on?" Frightened, I demanded.

"We just want to make sure you and your mommy are okay." Smiling, the second woman said. "There is a very bad cold going around."

Though I did not fully understand, I nodded and we were quickly led off the trans into the quarantine sector. Upon being led in, a team of people in white coats ushered mommy and I onto a cot and we were rushed into a room together. There was so much activity in the room, I could not follow it all and it was frightening me... I began to cry until I felt a sting in my arm and was instantly plunged into darkness...
11312.title: Quarantined!

113121.content:
My eyes slowly flickered open and I found myself lying in a simple but comfortable bed in a small, barren room. I sat up, feeling dizzy, due to whatever had hit me and took a careful look around. Behind me was a large window, over looking a small but inviting court yard. To my left was a sizable mirror, taking up almost a quarter of the wall. On the right was a door, leading to a tiny wash room. Across the room from me was a closed door, I guessed was the only way out. My memories of what had happened the night before were still fresh in my mind but, for some unknown reason, I was strangely unafraid, merely confused.

“Where am I?”

I crawled out of the bed and discovered that I was now wearing a fashionable pair of blue pajamas. Upon closer examination of myself, I found that I was carefully bandaged from head to foot, making me look somewhat like a mummy, only increasing my confusion.

“What happened to me?”

I looked down at my feet and found a pair of pink slippers, which I slipped on, then walked uneasily to the closed door. Of course, the door was locked. But, still in a daze, I was not detoured and pulled onto the door knob harder. The lock broke with a low crunch and the door handle ripped off in my hand as the door slowly drifted open in front of me. I looked at the handle, slightly surprised, then lightly dropped it to the floor as I then cautiously walked out into the hall.

“He- Hello?” Politely, I called. “I- I’m sorry about the door. Hello?”

I looked around as no one answered and began to slowly wander the halls, curiously taking yin my new environment, uncertain, but not afraid. “Hello? Is anyone here?”

"My but you are a strong girl." Startling me, a voice said.

I spun around to find a well dressed, tall and attractive young woman, standing in the hall. She smiled politely and motioned for me to follow her. Seeing no threat, I walked over to her. "Where am I?" Politely, I asked.

"You are in a safe place, I am Dr. Dani Dorsey." Calmly, the woman replied. "I do apologize for your injuries, there was a fight over you before we could get you here."

"A what...?!" Startled, I thought. Then i asked, "Have you seen my mommy?"

"All in due time, young lady." Kindly. Dr. Dorsey said. "Your mother is safe and resting. I was hoping we could have a little talk... won't you join me for some tea...?"
113121.title: I wake up in a strange place.

choices: Keep looking for somewhere to hide
Head back in defeat to Dr. Dorsey
1131212.content:
I don't even like tea. I don't want to be here with these strange people in this cold building away from home and school and everything I know. I cry out that I want to leave and before she can answer me, I am already running down the hallway. The last thing I see is Dr. Dorsey looking at me with a sad disappointment and shaking her head. I hear her saying something into a device on her wrist in a language I don't understand.

As I try to find a way out of the strange place with its sliding glass doors and blinding fluorescent lights, it makes sense that she won't bother chasing me. I have absolutely no idea where I am and security is at her disposal.

"Olivia honey," Dr. Dorsey called out. "I am not in the mood to go after you myself. Come back so we can get started, we have wasted enough time already." Her voice still sounds pleasant with a slightly threatening edge to it.
1131212.title: Uncooperative

11312121.content:
I turned to Dr. Dorsey just long enough to stick my tongue out at her and continue running, looking for a way out. I did not care where I was, I only cared about finding mommy and I cried out to her as I ran through the halls. What I didn't know was that doing so told security where I was. I was confronted by two men in uniforms as I rounded the first corner. "Do not be so problematic, young lady." Scolding, the first man said. "We are going to take you back to Dr. Dorsey."

"No you're not!" Defiantly, i snapped. "I'm gonna find mommy!"

With that said, I ran at them with a shrilling scream. The guards gave a bemused smile but gawked in surprise as I slid between the legs of the second guard and kept running, crying for mommy. It did not take long for the guards to give chase but I was far enough ahead to slip into a door and hide as they ran passed. After they were gone, I eased the door closed to give myself time to catch my breath.

"I want my mommy..." Crying, I muttered.

"You are a spirited one, little lady." Startling me, an old voice said.

I spun around to find an elderly Maltorian woman sitting in a chair staring at me. I was too frightened to move or even speak only the woman's kind smile caused me to relax a little. "Who... Who are you?"

"I am known as Elder." Kindly, the woman said. "I am the oldest Maltorian at one hundred and fifty years." She motioned me to come closer with a single finger. "Do you want to know why you are so important?"

This surprised me. "Important....?"

Elder nodded. "You and your mother are very important, my dear." Calmly, she said. "You see, we Maltorians are dying and so are the humans."

"Why...?" confused, I asked.

"You are a bit too young to understand why." Patiently, Elder said. "However, you have within you the power to save us all."

I tried to grasp what Elder was telling me. "You mean I'm a superhero?"

"Something like that." Bemused, Elder said. "You see, you and your mother come from a long line of humans who have defied illness again and again." She sighed. "The cure came to late, we had sealed our own fate... In our quest for power we brought upon our own last hour."

"Mom says that a lot..." Tearing up, I said.

"Your ancestors were conquerors, much like my ancestors, only we each made a fatal mistake... one that is slowly killing us all." Cryptically, Elder said. "You and your mother are the last living descendants who have the power to change everything."

"I don't understand." Shaking my head, I said.

Elder giggled. "You remember the story of Adam and Eve?"

I nodded. "Mom told me they were the first man and woman on Earth."

Elder nodded. "You are the new Eve."

"You mean I have to find and 'Adam'?" Making a face, I asked. Elder nodded. "Ewww!"

Elder smiled, bemused. "Not now... but eventually."

Just then, the door opened and in walked...
11312121.title: The new Eve.

113121211.content:
I tensed up seeing Dr Dorsey enter and instinctively hid behind Elder who giggled slightly at my move. "Did the doctor frighten you, child?" Calmly, she asked.

I nodded to which Elder turned to Dr Dorsey. "A firm hand does not win the trust of the young, especially not young humans." Scolding, she said. "Patience is the key."

"We do not have time for..." Sighing, Dr Dorsey began.

"Are you questioning my wisdom... doctor." More sternly, Elder demanded.

Dr Dorsey jumped before shaking her head. "I am not questioning you..."

"Then heed my advice." Firmly, elder said. "This child will fight you with everything she has until she gets what she thinks she wants."

Dr Dorsey was silent for a moment then nodded before pulling out what looked like an iPhone and punched in a number. "Talk to your mommy." Softly, she said.

I took the phone like device from Dr Dorsey and heard mommy's voice on the other line. "Who is this...?"

"Mommy, it's me, Olivia!" Crying, I said. "Where are you?"

"Olivia...?" Surprised, mommy asked. She sighed. "I was told you were very sick..."

"They told me we were both sick but I feel fine..." Worried, I said. "Where are you?"

"I'm in an a quarantine hospital room, honey." Patiently, mommy said. "Look at your arms, your legs... Do they look different?"

Curious, I looked at my arms and nearly screamed as I saw...
113121211.title: Dr. Dorsey.

choices: Ask Mr. Olly for a glass of water
11312122.content:
***


I move glass dish away and hide my face into my hands. It was the first and only time any of the researchers had seen a child turn down an ice cream.

Dr. Dorsey doesn't take it personal when I stop in the middle of my fleeing and turn back. Even so young, I know that there is no chance of getting out, at least not like this. The place is swarming with guards, security cameras, and protected from the outside lunar environment. Trapped in an inescapable fortress containing the precious oxygen that I needed to even survive out in space.

The scientist spent the rest of the day after my attempted escape trying to win me over with new dolls and sweet treats. She scanned her card and brought me into an area with vending panels and the loud buzz of a long refrigerator.
She explained that sometimes little boys and girls got sick and had to be taken somewhere special where they couldn't hurt others. Like their friends from school and their moms.

How would I feel, Dr. Dorsey asked me, if I gave someone the bad cold and they went away forever? When I ask her why no one here is worried about getting sick, she has a response for that too.

"That's why you're here Olivia. We're making the medicine to make everyone better and we really need your help." The scientist pushed the ice cream towards me again. "You need your strength but it doesn't hurt if you have some joy out of being here."

I picked up the spoon and dug into a scoop of vanilla. If my family was okay with me being here and they knew I was safe, I had to help out the scientists, right?

"That's a good girl. Now you finish that up and Mr. Olly will bring you to my lab."

Dr. Dorsey nodded to the head of security for the floor. He was a large men with a headset over his face where he could watch all of the activity at the facility and the public cameras back at the Hub. Holographic lines of DNA ID sequences zipped past his view. "Got it boss," he answered dismissively.

He was very focused on all the activity flashing through his eyes and brain. When he finally paid attention to me, he raised his voice and sneered.
"C'mon kid, I don't have all day. Doc needs you ready." Then he looked away from me to watch a red blinking line and scrambled video that I couldn't hear.
11312122.title: Sweet defeat

choices: Use the headset to contact help

113121221.content:
Mr. Olly jabbed the metal pick repeatedly onto the block of ice. He grumbled to whoever was on the other end of his headset about having to cater to a "bratty kid" and play babysitter. I pretended not to be eavesdropping. Although Dr. Dorsey had insisted that I could have whatever I wanted and I was using that to my advantage, I didn't want to anger the Head of Security too much.

He was definitely a human. There was no doubt about that. He lacked the slightly off physiology and prowess of the Maltorian who ran the lab. With this partnership, it was not uncommon for some humans to do whatever undesired jobs the others had no time or want to do. That's how you had someone like Mr. Olly, an imposing detail-oriented man who watched over and in return, the Maltorian high command provided his family with resources.

For now however, he was stuck scraping ice to dump into my water. "More please." I told him when he showed me the glass. When he was about to say something else to me, I brought up Dr. Dorsey again and that she had wanted me to be as comfortable as possible. Mr. Olly shook his head, mumbling, and lifted up the long refrigeration unit.

Water was one of the most precious resources anywhere, especially here on the Moon. It was one of the few things that the Maltorians hadn't been able to maximize the production of. Instead, they relied on units that connected to an underground reservoir that pumped clean, ice-cold water back up through the refrigeration unit. When his shoulder lifting up the heavy lid, Mr. Olly was trying to multitask by keeping his eye on the security video streams. That was when I saw my chance.

I picked up the DNA ID that he had left on the table. Without second guessing it, I threw it and watched as it flew through the air and landed inside the refrigeration unit. Mr. Olly immediately started cursing as he now had to dig through the ice. "You little brat, we are going right to Doc after this.." He grumbled and complained about his hands feeling raw and cold from picking through the ice. But right when it seemed like he had found the ID, I was ready to make my first move.

I felt bad about it for a second. Mr. Olly couldn't see me hop down from my chair and crawl towards the unit until I reached the panel on the side. The Maltorians had no sense of occupational safety like humans did. Their devices were functional and the best at it with no regard for safety as long as they were efficient.

I felt bad for about a second before I mashed my hand against the panel. Then again, these people had kidnapped me and Mr. Olly was part of it, a bully who did whatever they told him to even if it meant hurting or intimidating a kid.

The unit began to buzz loudly. "What the h-?" Mr. Olly yelled. His hand was still in the device when the whole machine began to pressurize. Before he could lift himself out, the force brought the lid down on his head and his body collapsed right into the machine. With a loud snap, the unit closed and began to whir as the temperature inside dropped to below subzero degrees.

As I back away from the machine, I nearly step on Mr. Olly's headset. I am shocked at myself for what I did.. there was no way I wouldn't be in trouble now. I had ki... I couldn't even say it in my own head. When I put the large headset on my face, the base and all of its labs were now in my open sight. I could see everything and everyone - and I still had no time since no one had been alerted to the commotion I had just caused.
113121221.title: Deep freeze

1131212211.content:
The headset isn't much use to me. It is full of previously used DNA IDs but I can't figure out how to contact Mom or anyone else that could help me out of this. I'm not as familiar with the Maltorian-specific devices and the menu options are blinking in their strange language. "Hello?" I call out into the receiver. I'm trying not to look at the refrigerator. It hasn't yet hit me.

Instead I back away and begin to exit the room when suddenly the door opens again.

"Olivia honey, we're still waiting for you." Dr. Dorsey comes inside with a trio of guards that now block my way out. Before I can try to explain, one of the guards gasps. He nudges Dr. Dorsey to catch her attention but she is already aware. Out of all the reactions, I do not expect it when she chuckles and shakes her head as if I just knocked over a vase. She walks up to Mr. Olly's frost-ridden hand, which sticks out of the refrigerator, and slams the lid back down. With a crunch, the hand disappears and I hear the unit whirring, still functioning with the body crammed inside of it.

"Shame about that," Dr. Dorsey says. "He was good at his job. Never late. Never questioned anything. We'll just have to hope the next one is just as dedicated, right?" She smiles at me. I am not sure what to say back since she is being so pleasant about everything, not unlike the trio of guards who glare and whisper to each other.

"Now, we really must get going." The scientist continues. "Unless you plan on disposing of more staff."

Obediently, I follow Dr. Dorsey out of the room with the guards flanking me on each side. I am more confused than ever as to what is going on in these labs but if I want answers (and a possible way out), I'll have to play along with whatever is happening. Walking around with them, I realize that the facility is a lot larger than I had noticed before.

There are many other rooms and labs connected to the main hallway, as well as what looks like a greenhouse and recreational area like the gymnasium at school. She leads me to my next destination, which I discover is _______

1131212212.content:
It doesn't take long for Dr. Dorsey to send a pair of guards to escort me back to the lab. When the two men come into the room, at first they're confused. There is no sign of a young girl and there is no sign of Mr. Olly. The pick that he had been using to carve up the ice laid in a melted puddle and the ice cream sundae was untouched on the table. Finally one of them realizes that the refrigerator is making a concerning sound. Rumbling and quaking as if something has been jammed into it.

The two guards struggled to lift up the lid, mumbling about the overly complicated set-up of Maltorian technology and how their lives completely depend on it now. Then when they realize what has happened, they begin to dry heave for a couple of seconds before running out and shouting into their communication wristbands. I am completely out of sight, of course- watching the gruesome scene from up above in the vents, where I have beat my own record for holding my breath and staying motionless in place. When they are gone, I finally take another breath. It wasn't hard for me, being small, to find the right spot in the wall where I could squeeze through the vents. Even if they thought of sending someone through, it would be impossible for any adult to come crawling in without the possibility of suffocating in the tight space.

The headset around my face is frenetic with activity and I can see it all. The heat signatures of the scrambling guards, the scientists in their lab (one of which is Dr. Dorsey) and other beings too distant to identify. It wasn't hard to disable the outgoing and incoming signals on the device which leaves me as a ghost on the network. We learned how to use most of the common Maltorian equipment at school, and us kids just had a natural ease with learning the tech.

I heard an alarm go off somewhere and I knew it was going to get even more crazy. The search would escalate and I couldn't just hide forever in this same spot in the vents. Was there anyone here who wasn't part of this mysterious project to experiment on colonist kids? I could play the ghost for a little longer and find some answers...
1131212212.title: Use the headset to find a safe spot

choices: "been asleep for a very long time!"
11312122121.content:
I have no idea where I am going. The vents obviously lead to different places around the building, it is just too dark and after what feels like hours of going around in a circle, my breaths are becoming shorter. I also remember why Mom brought me here in the first place. My head is burning again, I haven't taken any medication in hours.
Before I can pass out, from being exhausted, my twitching eyelids are blinded by a bright white light. It flashes once then after a few minutes, it happens again. It isn't easy but I crawl to chase it, maybe even wondering if this is the fever.

But then I hear voices. Voices that I know! Like that awful Dr. Dorsey and the sound of strangers.

"Any update?" I can see her through the vents. The pretty scientist paces back and forth. It is still hard to believe that she is behind something terrible, she seems young like one of Mom's aunts.

When one of the guard answers Dr. Dorsey and shakes his head, her calmness ends right away.
"Get out of my sight until you find out where she is!" She screams at the guard and tosses a clipboard at him. Humiliated, he turns around and disappears. His partner turns to also follow but Dr. Dorsey keeps him behind.

She walks to her desk, tosses a bunch of papers, and opens a drawer. The guard looks surprised when she pulls a bottle out and takes a long drink from it! She makes a happy sound and offers some to the guard but he says no.

"First kill, can you believe that?" Her voice sounds like she is really sleepy. "She took down your boss without a pause"

"I don't want to hear this. I am just here for the job." The guard says in disgust.

I feel the sickness getting to me. Every part of my body hurts! But I have my full attention on what Dr. Dorsey is saying.

"I am just wondering," she smiles. "If it dies, does one of the others keeps the memories of her past life? Her fears? Maybe even that moment where she faded to nothing."

Her eyes look crazy with a madness that gives both of us the creeps. I am so thankful to be hidden out of sight from all this even as all of me is sweating and aching. My stomach growls with the feeling to vomit. I don't want to puke in this small space, this is the worst day I've ever had. Then before I can pass out, I hear the guard talk again.

"Doctor, you need to come with me. Now."

The guard finishes talking to someone on his headset and disconnects. He reaches out to grab Dr. Dorsey's wrist. Before he can make contact, she raises the bottle and crashes it on his head. After she crawls out from under him, she stands up and crushes his headset with her heel. I don't stay conscious for much longer after that. It becomes impossible to breath and my head feels like it splits open. My eyelids close and then there is nothing but darkness.

**


The walls of the room are shiny and white. Machines make sounds all around me. When I try to get up, my arms and legs are strapped to the bed. When I open my mouth to cry out, I am silenced. A series of tubes connect at a mask that covers my face. All my struggling catches the attention of a woman dressed in white who comes to my bed and begins to fix the tubes. "Hey now! Stop that. Let me give you something to calm you, honey, you've ________"

11312122122.content:
There is no way I can get out of this alone. I tap the side of the headset to check the other features on the device. I scroll through settings which don't show me anything new. However I see a list of contacts that I can access. If I connect again to the lab network, I may have one chance to send out a single message and disconnect before being discovered.

Their search has been going on for 20 minutes already and no one has even considered the ventilation system which is exposed and completely accessible by someone of their size. It never crosses their mind and instead, Dr. Dorsey leads the guards around in a frenzied panic, checking and rechecking the same areas again. I haven't moved from my spot near the break room. Although I can move fine and freely, I just have this fear of ending up stuck nowhere with no chance of rescue.

The device pops up a green screen where I can now see general numbers to call and a field to enter someone's DNA ID. This wouldn't be much help but I happen to know one very well and that is because of the early lessons at school. If I call Mom, what could she even do to get me out of here? I see that one of the most contacted numbers in the menu is for the Lunar Community Force. The Maltorians didn't take away all of our freedom to govern myself. They knew most humans would refuse to listen if they didn't have some representation. The LCF was the community patrol of the moon and the Maltorians were the overlords. I didn't know if they could even help but from the times that one of their officers came for Career Day, they were friendly and known for occasional disobedience when it came to the colony.

I think about who I can send my message out to - I don't think I have much time, as dumb as everyone here is, someone will get the idea to check my space and from the words they shout, I don't expect a good ending.
11312122122.title: SOS

choices: Crawl towards the front of the facility for a better view
113121221221.content:
It takes longer than I expect to get a signal. Time feels like it is not on my side as the device beeps and attempts another reconnect. Is it too late? Am I doomed to die in here until they find me or I die of thirst and hunger? Being off the grid had made me feel confident about my hide and seek skills. But now I need a save, I can't do it on my own. Please, I beg to the headset as if it isn't anything other than a soulless piece of technology. Time is running out.

Mom says the weather changes so much on the Moon that sometimes different parts of the Colony are unable to communicate or visit each other for weeks. If that is the case, I don't stand a chance at all. I'll run out of supplies and no one will be able to rescue me. But before I give up hope on being able to cast a distress signal, it happens- I can connect.

The DNA ID of the patrol flashes and I hear a chime as the video finally loads. "Hello? Help!" I cry out.
The face of a stern, middle-aged man in a dark blue uniform flickers between static bursts and when he speaks, his words cut in and out, making him difficult to understand. "This is Tanaka speaking..." T he signal finally stabilizes.
"What the hell do you want, Station Delta? This line is for emergencies."

After a few seconds, my transmission must be clearer as well because his eyes become less angry. "You are not.. the Head of Security." He says, his tone now being a lot more gentle and patient. "Who are you?"

He can now see who he is talking to. A terrified human girl hiding in the darkness.
"They're snatching children!" I begin to sob. "I don't know what they do exactly, but there are these experiments..."

Tanaka grimaces. His face looks furious and at first, I am not sure if he is mad at me or what I'm saying.

"I got out.. They're looking for me and I don't have a lot of time!"

"Those Maltorians have been up to no good since the Pact... we just haven't had proof! But this is it, this is the push we have needed to free ourselves of them. What is your name, child?"

I wipe my tears with my sleeve and answer. I don't mention my exact location because although Tanaka has all the makings of an Earth loyalist, Mom had always taught me never to give anyone, especially a stranger, 100% of my trust. Especially now being the case when I am already in so much danger.

"Stay put, Olivia. Don't let them see you - and don't come out until we play the signal."

Before I can ask him what that is going to be, his face cuts out. I start to feel a little safer, knowing that Tanaka and the LCF are on the way, but my stomach rumbles with both the hunger and worry that I am about to be caught between something really bad.

I know it is a really bad idea and I've already had too much luck with it in the first place but that alone doesn't stop me from dialing in the DNA ID number again. I felt safe when I was talking to Captain Tanaka. One of the few times while being trapped in this place and while being helplessly alone. I knew that the LCF would get me out of here but they had to show up before it was too late.

The image of a moon is rotating on my screen. Tanaka's DNA ID flashes until it turns green. Unlike last time, the signal comes in crystal clear without any issues. The signal meter shows that I am at maximum connectivity which my small knowledge of these devices means... I am connecting with someone nearby. Instead of the man I had spoken to before, the video shows the face of a familiar attractive woman in her late 20s, her long brown hair tied back in a ponytail, and the collar of her lab coat visible in the feed.

"There you are, Olivia." Dr. Dorsey smiles. "You've sure caused us a lot of trouble for us but there is still a chance to save yourself."

My face goes white with terror. I desperately try to shut the device on but the video of the sinisterly smiling woman remains until I grab the headset and rip it off my face. Even without having it near me, at the loudest volume possible, I hear her yelling at me to get out of there immediately. It was all my fault for trying to get in contact again.. it made sense that a crazy scientist like Dr. Dorsey would be smart to catch on to whatever I was planning.

"Save yourself!" The voice crackles again through the overturned headset. I'm not sure whether to give up or to keep hiding.

I've made it too far on my own to just give and leave my hiding spot. Especially with rescue on its way in any moment.. I think this to myself even though I have no idea what the situation is like out in the lunar environment. Could there be storms? Problems with equipment? Crawling through the vents is uncomfortable and there doesn't seem to be many places to go - they connect all throughout the facility but only certain areas are wide enough for me to slide into. I woke up to a familiar voice and I immediately flailed my arms and legs. But I couldn't move much. This was worse than just being strapped to a table: I was trapped inside some sort of sphere, and when I screamed for help, nothing came out of my mouth. I couldn't even hear my echo inside the clear circular prison.

I wanted to throw out every curse word I had learned at her - but it was useless. No movement, no speech.. this was definitely Maldorian technology at its worst - designed for the sole purpose of tormenting humans. "We were able to clear up the misunderstanding."

I still have my sight and I can see that the laboratory is massive. There's other scientists in coats checking tanks and toying with the dials on blinking panels.

"You are a clever child, you know that. You've probably wondered all your life why you are so different. Smarter than all the other kids. They call you an old soul, right?" Dr. Dorsey comes close to my jail sphere. "Not a coincidence, of course. The future and survival of this colony are in your blood, Olivia."

She signals one of her workers to turn a knob all the day. It is seconds later that I feel it. A surge of electricity or whatever power they use in this laboratory.. it now begins coursing through the sphere, tingling at my fingertips, and spreading throughout my body. It is a good thing I can't scream. Instead, I begin to think about what Dr. Dorsey was saying. Being different? Yeah, that is true. I don't talk like the other kids my age, I don't have anything close to the same interests as them. There is also that mysterious sickness which now seems like the least of my problems.

Zzzzzzzzzzzzzt! What are they doing to me? I don't feel any pain but the flow that is powering everything is shaking me to my core. I don't even know if this process will kill me, so I begin to comfort myself by thinking about...
113121221221222.title: Experimentation

Focus on somewhere else to disrupt the device
1131212212212221.content:
The beeping sounds around me grew in volume. I felt like they were going to give me the most severe headache I had ever experienced. I could only hear Dr. Dorsey's voice and that was starting to sound more distant by the second.

"She's doing it! Don't lose focus, child! Think back to your ancestral land, remember the moment that started that fateful chain of events..."

I close my eyes and take a deep breath to relax myself. The egglike device that I am inside of is spinning furiously, an out of control centrifuge in which every moment begins to feel like an agonizing eternity.

Then there is the feeling nothingness. That too begins to feel like an eternity and with my eyes closed, I have no sense of time or awareness, even Dr. Dorsey's excited instructions echo away into the beyond. When I do open my eyes, I am free again. But the sight of what I am looking at makes me want to faint.

I am no longer at the lab with Dr. Dorsey. Which means I am no longer imprisoned in anything but the view of tall silver skyscrapers and realizing I am in the middle of a busy street is a shock. I had only seen them in movies about Earth. Our ancestors had to deal with traffic and walking as they lived out their daily lives like tiny ants moving around their cities.

"Hey! Minggir!" A person on a bicycle zips past me ringing their bell like a madman. "Get out of the way!" He yells as he disappears onto the crowd-filled sidewalk. I have never seen so many people together like this. Everyone just blends into each other, the young and the old, the street beggars and the men in what I learned were called suits. So this was the Earth... I look up into the skyline to admire the skyscrapers. Some are older than most of the people on the streets and I wonder if they ever think about the lives that were sacrificed to create these views.

I am so overwhelmed by the noises and sights of the city that I haven't paid attention to two things. When I look down at my hands, I see that they are older and like a human man's. When I reach to touch my face, my fingers find the base of a cloth mask over my mouth. With everything I had experienced thanks to Dr. Dorsey, the mask doesn't even seem so noticeable.

It is at this moment when I notice that everyone else, the thousands of people running around this city, also wear protection over their faces. What a strange time, could this have been what Dr. Dorsey had meant when she was keeping me in her lab? The chain of events. This also makes me wonder if I want to continue exploring this.. dream? Or if it is time to go home and refuse to answer whatever Dr. Dorsey and the Maldorians are trying to discover.
1131212212212221.title: J A K A R T A

113121222.content:
The head of security stood by me, making me uncomfortable as I tried to finish the ice cream sundae. It wasn't going down. The syrupty cherry had already brought about an aching nausea. I dropped the spoon and coughed into my arm, struggling to eat much more of it. Any kid would've sold out their family to the Maltorians for even a scoop of ice cream. It was that hard to find and really more of a thing for the very wealthy or the brave Maltorians who kept it as a culinary curiosity.

As much as I wanted to, I couldn't stomach another bite without wanting to throw up all over the place. The large man shook his head as if he is watching a wounded animal on a documentary. When he does this, one of his eyes doesn't move at all. Instead it wobbles without motion inside his socket. Mom had told me some veterans had glass eyeballs. Some even had legs made out of metal and plastic.

Wars were like that, they took away life and if you survived, sometimes you lost part of your body. That was one thing I had never worried about on the Moon. The Maltorians had basically created world peace, just in a much smaller population and not quite on a world.

But if this man was a veteran, why was he working with the Maltorians in this creepy place? I couldn't help myself and blurted out without thinking.

"Are you from Earth?"

He tapped on his temple as if I had interrupted him from a call. Then without answering my question, he laughed.

"I'm from the same place you're from. That's why I would never eat that."

Mr. Olly replied with a serious tone and before I could ask him what he had meant by any of that, his attention was back to beeping scans. I pushed the bowl away with tears swelling in my voice. I hate this, I hate these people and this place. I want to go home and see Mom.

"Alright kid, I gotta take you back."

Not having any other choice, I left the dessert melting and went out the door with the large man. We walked down a hallway that led into Dr. Dorsey's lab. The plated door leading inside was blocked by an eye scanner and under the vigilance of four rotating cameras that extend and capture every angle of the entrance. Something about going beyond that door made me tremble. I look at Mr. Olly's face to see if he has any guilt, but he is ready to scan his retinas to gain access. As he placed the gear over his face, he paused for a moment.

"How old did you say you were?"

I told him and he flinched as if he had been slapped in the face. He shook his head, mumbling under his breath. Then he stopped talking and nodded as if he was making a decision.
"Before we go again, just answer me this:
What is easy to get into, but hard to get out of?"

Not completely sure, I answer the first thing that comes to mind...
113121222.title: Finish up the sundae

1131212221.content:
With a look of disappointment, he looked me in the eyes. His tone was solemn and he looked back to his normal self of hiding any facial motions.

"You never get that wrong. Have you heard that one before?"

I shook my head. I didn't know myself why I had responded like that. The answer came to me immediately, as if it had come from a dream that I could never forget, ready for the moment to respond dutifully. Why did my whole life start to feel like that now?

Mr. Olly chuckled dryly. "I hate this, but until something extraordinary happens, we don't have much of a choice but to go with it." He picked up the scanner and brought it to his face. I could see him blinking briefly before the doors of the lab began to slide open.

They were a lot like the hissing elevator doors I had seen in old videos. As they made the inside more visible, I was amazed at what I saw on the other side. It was a space that appeared way longer than I could've imagined. The room seemed to never end and it was full of machines that beeped so softly that they were like a buzz.

Giant glass tanks filled the room as well, with whatever was beneath the glass, unseen in the cloudy water. Then she came to us, holding a clipboard, appearing out of thin air or just from outside of my sight. There was just so much going on and she was completely alone. No other guards. No fellow scientists helping her.

"Ah, there you both are. I was beginning to worry." Dr. Dorsey smiled in a way that made me feel chills. I knew she was human but there was just something very off about her.

"She's a standard one," Mr. Olly said. "She won't give you any trouble."

"That is great to hear. We haven't had much luck lately, have we Gregor?"

I was so confused by what they were talking about but the more I concentrated on the lab, the more creeped out I began to feel. There was more medical equipment than I thought, trays full of cotton balls and sanitizer. Scalpels and pliers that looked brand new but very menacing. Then I had to look twice because something in one of the tanks was definitely moving, stirring inside the hazy water and splashing.

Mr. Olly turned pale and looked in horror. He was about to say something but before he could, Dr. Dorsey had already reached into her lab coat and pulled it out. Something inside the pocket clicked and in an instant, Mr. Olly disappeared with a loud pop.

"You crazy witch! What did you do?" I screamed at her. She started to laugh and point down to the floor where something round was moving around. Scared but curious enough to check it out, I got closer and gasped. It looked like a peach-colored marble twitching by itself. "Mr. Olly?"

"Time to retire the old boy." Dr. Dorsey said with disappointment before she smiled again, excited like a kid during the Celebration of Lights. "His replacement will be here very shortly!" She looked sinister as she pointed her finger directly...

1131212222.content:
Mr. Olly shook his head as if I had said the dumbest thing ever. Then to my surprise, he did something I never would've expected from the stern-looking henchman. He smiled.

"That is completely wrong, kid, but I have never heard one of you say that before." The head guard turned his face away from the scanner and bent down on one knee to look at me closer. He tapped the side of his head and a red light began to blink on the device.

"They won't be able to trace me for a minute or two, so listen and don't freak out."

His voice was quick and panicked, I hadn't heard him sound anything like that when he was talking to the other guards or Dr. Dorsey even. It was strange to see his calm coolness gone so fast.

"We've had that exchange dozens, maybe even a hundred times, and you've never answered that wrong." He led us away from the door and back onto the hallway.

"W-what do you mean?"

He looked sad for a moment. As if his whole life was flashing before his eyes. His voice was shaking when he spoke again.

"It means that I'm not going to take them to you. Not this time. Not again."

He took the headset and dropped it to the ground. Then to my surprise, he raised his boot and stomped the device until it crunched.

"That'll buy you some time, get out now! There's a hatch inside the main utility closet. It leads to a passageway underground between this lab and the main colony. They don't know what she is doing here so just go to the highest power you can."

I stared at Mr. Olly in total confusion. But this is what I was waiting for, a chance to get away at least from here and find Mom again. Without saying another word, I headed towards away from Dr. Dorsey's lab and down the corridors of this eerily-white lighted facility. There were cameras everywhere - but whatever Mr. Olly did before he went off the grid had knocked them offline, at least for a little while. I was worried about bumping into other people as well but it had been pretty empty up to this point.

That is until I hear a pair of shoes on the linoleum. Then I hear two voices talking to each other as they begin to corner the hallway. I can either pull off some serious acting on the two guards or scientists coming by or head into one of the nearest unlocked rooms instead.

11312122221.content:
I heard voices echoing from their com device before they turned onto the hallway where I was completely trapped and with nowhere to run or hide. "Check on Gregor. No response." Someone said through a com speaker. As soon as their boots came into view, I was already curled up on the ground. "Oh damn!" One of the guards gasped. The other started cursing and stepped closer.

"Is she alive?"

"I'm not a medic, man." I could feel him nearby but he never came to take a pulse or check if I was breathing. With my eyes completely shut facing the floor and my body limp like a ragdoll, I had already made the guard squeamish.

"Those Olly units sometimes go berserk." The closest guard to me said. His boot was only a few inches away from my laying face. "You're lucky you weren't here last year when these rogue Olivias managed to hijack one. We lost a few guys that year."

The guard clicked on his device and I could hear the faint sound of a woman's voice screaming on the other end.

"Yes, ma'am. I understand." The guard replied back, I could hear his voice nervous and shaky. "We'll head over right away."

I felt their bodies as they stepped over me and began to head in the opposite direction. "Dr. Dorsey is trapped, the Olly is barricading the doors and threatening to cause some pain. I hope you're good with that pistol." The two men disappeared as their footsteps turned into running and they were gone to handle the emergency. I couldn't believe it.. what did they mean by Olivias? Why were they talking about us as if this had happened before?

When I was sure they were gone, I got back up. I was close to the utility closet and it seemed like there were no more people on patrol. Without no one spotting me, I went inside and locked it, my heart racing as I looked around for the exit.

Finally after what felt like the longest three minutes, I grabbed onto the handle of the chute that would be leading to some unknown underground passageway. I pulled my arms as hard as I could to lift it. But nothing, my hands couldn't even shake the small door. Now what, I couldn't just punch my way through the metal frame and the handle felt loose already. The space of the utility closet might offer something. I could see dusty shelves of cleaning products and a mop leaning against the wall.

The Maltorians arrived on Earth in the mid 2040s; looking for a new world to settle after fleeing their home system. What they found was a planet on the verge of destruction; thanks to humanity causing irreversible damage to the environment. The Maltorians offered to use their advanced technology to repair the planet - the catch was that it would take 25 years to do so.

In the meantime, the Maltorians and the remaining humans would live in a colony on the Moon. The humans believed the Maltorians were their saviors, but they didn't know the Maltorians were hiding something from them - something that would have devastating consequences for humanity.
